name: Grack Juice
description: This is a grape-cactus that is as disturbing as it is delightful. I really can't say more about what it is 'supposed to taste like.' It is an experience unto itself.
author: Philosaphucker

reviews.text: Delightfully weird and unsurprisingly refreshing

I’m really not sure how I feel about this one? I can’t even describe the taste it is so weird. Upon the first taste I was thinking “This is it!” And almost mixed up a 120ml right there. Decided to just stick with 30ml to ensure it was worth the ingredients. A day later and I’m not sure. It’s good, but it’s really strange and I just can’t decide if I like it or not.

This juice is INSANE. I can see why it's a love it or hate it kind of thing but you HAVE to try it. Like everyone says, it can't really be described other than to say its totally unique. The floral notes are definitly there. Then you get a whole pile of different fruit flavours. I can't put my finger on what they are but they are all stand-alone, you get this whole bouquet in your mouth... whereas I find most other mixed fruit recipes all end up kind of being the same kind of bland muddle of nothing. The flavour is intense on inhale and exhale without any of that nasty lingering 'stuff' on your pallette (stickiness, or a throat clawing sweetness for example) which is why this is the ONLY juice I've ever mixed myself that could be an ADV. When I'm feeling down about all my other juices, grack juice is there to make me smile. If I had to only mix one juice ever, for the rest of the time, Grack Juice is currently the only contender.
I'm not a fan of  this recipe but the buddy I gave it to loved it.  But he accidentally put the grack lid on a different juice and I had to give him that bottle too.
I was very excited about this due to the reviews. This juice is just awful. INW Grape tastes like the weird floral note that is in most commercial Skittles juices. Just nasy stuff, not for me
Countless bottles of Grack Juice have poured into my lungs, and I can honestly say I will never have enough. This recipe is immortal.

Mixed this quite awhile ago so my memory of this recipe isn't very fresh. This has a great natural grape juice profile with pretty strong floral notes. Not really my cup of tea but very nice recipe for sure.

Incredibly awesome!!! Definitely worth the reputation and getting every single ingredient in the recipe in case you don't have it in order to mix this.
It is fresh, sweet, juicy, cool and the various fruits are in some sort of rave party :)

I can't believe I've not reviewed this. It's been a staple since it was released. Grapey, juicy, wet, and weird. It's perfect. I like it both with koolada and without. Sometimes I'll also throw a half percent EM at it to round it off and sweeten it up a bit more.
This was one of my first DIY recipes I ever tried and the one that I love the most. The flavours mix together beautifully and give an unique taste. It's fresh, tasty and addictive!
Fun, tasty and weird in only the best way possible. Cold juicy grape candy freakiness, a fruit Frankenstein.

This recipe is both weird and awesome at the same time, its a must try, at least the once, its surprisingly addictive, this would never have been my go to profile for what i would want to try but im so glad i mixed this up.

This is so damn addictive. This is the only recipe I vape where I have to cut my nic level in half because its so hard to put down! I just got some WS-23 finally and replaced the Koolada with it at 1%. This recipe really sings now with that swap. Just mix this recipe its awesome!
The description of this is perfect.  I can't believe how much I've come to love this.  At first I thought I was going to end up dumping it, and now I can't put it down.

Smells disgusting, tastes like a lilac colored soap, first few hits were a huge letdown, and i have no idea why i always crave the next hit. It doesn't make any sense. Why do i love this? How did i become addicted? I always want to chain vape grack juice now. This is an abstract delight that is hard to describe.
How can I love this?  It smells disgusting.  But it's so tasty in a very strange way.
Very good flavor.  Grape is a bit strong, but it can be toned down a bit and it blends well with the other flavors.  Definitely a top 10 flavor.

My favorite juice. I've vaped a liter of it in the last 4-5 months and can't imagine slowing down anytime soon. It's the juice I crave throughout the day and is practically the only thing I vape when I get home. Wish I could give it 6 stars. Thank you for sharing Philosaphucker!

Kinda reminds me of the grape flavoured aloe juice.  As posted it's a little heavy on the INW Cactus for me - I just find it sort of builds up on my palette and is a bit too much by the end of the day.  It's perfect for me at 1.0-1.5% Cactus (blasphemy, I know!).

So ya, as everyone else was curious as to if this was actually good or not...This is surprisingly good. It does come off as a floral grape, but its pleasant. I went through a 30 of this very quickly and turned around to make 120. Great job, this is in my rotation.
pure genius this recipe is phenomenal!!! open to so many alterations aswell (other grapes/mango etc)
I have a ton of recipes on my to-try list, but I keep making this instead.  Never had a juice taste quite like it... hard to describe, in the best way.
This flavour profile works so well, who knew cactus would taste good at that high a percentage.

This recipe is interesting and I have a friend who absolutely loves it.  Based on the reviews, I decided to try it even though I don't like grape juice or grape candy, never have, but I do love actual grapes.  I personally didn't like it, though I think I preferred it before steeping vs. after a couple weeks.  As someone said before, if you're not a fan of grape flavored things, Id only recommend trying Grack if you have a friend who'll take it off your hands if you don't dig it.   Don't forget to mix a low nic level if your nic level is higher than your friend's.  Thanks, Vurve, for the recipes--- this is the only one
I don't love!!

I must say, the description of this is spot on.  It's disturbing.  I've vaped over 240ml in the past 2 months, not only is this an awesome palate cleanser because it's so different, but it's actually odd how sometimes a note you've never tasted just squeaks its way through.  Regardless of how this monstrosity was created, it's delicious!

I had heard a lot about it, so I mixed it. When I smelled it I have to say that I was thrown off and didn't try it for a while. Wayne mentioned it again recently so I cleaned up my atomizer and I'm impressed. Very happy with this mix.

You have seriously turned me into a damn Grackhead! I will not leave the house with out this shit. I have a tank that has never seen anything other than grack, and probably never will. I mix this more than anything else, and always have at least 60ml of it laying around. I can see why this won recipe of the year on the sub reddit and it was well deserved.
After all the issues I've had tasting flavors, I can say that I always taste this recipe. It almost never tastes the same as the last taste, but always tastes great.

I gotta say your a genius for coming up with this madness. I like it best without the koolada because I just hate anything menthol basically. And at first I hated this juice, because I got a weird alcohol note. But like others have said, I just keep coming back to this. I kept just making 30's because I didn't think I would like this. Then I made 60's. Now I'm making 120's lol. Great job man!
This is absolutely crazy. There is so much going on, and once you start, you can't stop.

Just want to start by saying, I hate Koolada.  Now I love this recipe it is perfectly balance from the Grape to the Koolada to the sweetner. This shit is really addictive. Awesome dam recipe. Mix it people!!!!!!! p.s. I now have a reason for owning Koolada

Amazing recipe, really good job. Can't say much about it that hasn't already been said. Just take the dive and get the flavors if you're tired of the usual and are looking for a unique juice experience.

This is a trip. My first time using koolada and my first thought upon vaping it was "to hell with that koolada - this would be fantastic if not for that," but after vaping it for a while, I'm not so sure. There is something about it that just hits the spot. Next time I may mix without the koolada, but may not - who knows? Not I, said the fly - all I say is this juice is a trip. And as a lover of psychedelia, that's a good thing...

Best juice I've ever had that smells like soap. To me the cactus never calmed down and stayed just a bit too floral, but it's still good and the profile is balanced. Weirdest thing is that every flavor in this recipe aside from the strawberry has given me some sort of throat irritation at some point, but this? Even with koolada, it's so smooth I can barely believe it.
This is an amazing profile, mixed up 300ml over the weekend. One question...is anyone getting a slight purple tint off of this juice?

I saw this recipe with all its reviews and raves and thought ok, I'll give it a shot.  The only grape vape I ever liked was one based off of Big League Chew bubble gum, so I was prepared to hate this mix.  Instead I found out this is so different from nearly anything else, that it is almost impossible to really describe.  The Grape presents well but the juciness of the cactus and the cool feeling from the koolada bring it to the top.  If you hate grape flavored candy or grape juice maybe this recipe isn't for you, but if you like grape at all you need to try this.  I just mixed up 2 120's :-D

Yo, this shit is weird. You already know that if you've read the other reviews, though. Grape takes the foreground with a juicy cactus forward fruitiness following. The koolada perfectly cools it down. Reminds me of vaping Hawk Sauce back in the day but so so so so much better!

Super juicy, super fresh, super tasty!  I now have this handy in a tank when I want something refreshing and quenching. A get a touch of vapers tongue after pulling on my adv all day, and this sorts that out in an instant. Thank you.

What the? I don't even particularly like fruit mixes but I had everything I needed to make this so took a shot based on the reviews. On my first taste I pulled a face like a child does on their first taste of sprouts but could not help and go back for another pull, then another and another and then I redripped it. What the hell is this voodoo?
Really weird juice, but in a good way, waiting for summer to roll round to really appreciate it.
Luscious? Terrifying? I think this juice shows a great grasp of how all of these flavors interact.  It's a tone poem.
And if thou gaze long into an abyss, the abyss will also gaze into thee.
This juice really surprised me! Not tasted anything like this before. It's delicious. Thanks for sharing!
This is really good.....
To be totally honest I used CAP grapes instead of the INW one (I don't have it). Surprisingly good! I was scared at first, but the cactus is pretty enjoyable at this %. Thanks for sharing!

Pretty new to this DIY scene and saw this recipe mentioned on reddit. Being a lover of grape vape I immediately put an order in for the flavours I was missing. Hats off to you man, this really is a delicious /mind bending recipe! Its definitely inspired me to start to understand flavour profiles and hopefully in time attempt to make something as creative as this. Thank you sir and look forward to trying some of you're other creations.
This recipe is so fucking weird...I seriously love it.
Like vaping a Dali painting. I couldn't put it down!
Spectacularly weird but shockingly smooth and well-balanced. This is definitely the bizarre bolt-out-of-the-blue I was looking for. Thanks for this!
